skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.
skill.summary: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to wri...
skill.author: AstraBit-CPT

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond AI default capabilities.

content.value_statement: Writing documentation alone is time-consuming and often misses key context. This skill provides a structured workflow to collaborate with AI through context gathering, iterative refinement, and reader testing to produce documents that actually work for readers.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through three-stage documentation workflow
Gather and organize project context efficiently
Structure and draft document sections iteratively
Test documents with fresh AI to catch blind spots
Refine content based on reader feedback
Provide scaffolding for various doc types
limitations: Requires active user participation and input
Sub-agent testing only available in Claude Code
Quality depends on user-provided context completeness

use_cases.title: Write Technical Specifications
use_cases.description: Create detailed technical specs with architecture decisions, API definitions, and implementation details.

use_cases.title: Draft Decision Documents
use_cases.description: Document product decisions with trade-offs, alternatives considered, and rationale for stakeholders.

use_cases.title: Create Project Proposals
use_cases.description: Write compelling proposals with problem statements, solutions, timelines, and resource requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Start Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to write a [document type] about [topic]. Can you guide me through your structured co-authoring workflow?

prompt_templates.title: Refine Existing Doc
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an existing document that needs refinement. Let me share it and walk through your documentation workflow to improve it.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Spec Start
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write a technical spec for [feature]. Audience is [team/department]. Key points: [brief context]. Let's use the co-authoring workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Team Decision Doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Our team needs to document why we chose [option] over [alternatives]. This is for [stakeholders]. Guide me through creating a decision document.

output_examples.input: Help me write a PRD for our new authentication system
output: I'll guide you through our structured documentation workflow. This has three stages:
1. **Context Gathering** - You share all relevant context while I ask clarifying questions
2. **Refinement & Structure** - We build the document section by section together
3. **Reader Testing** - We test if the doc works for readers who don't have your context
Would you like to try this workflow? Or would you prefer to work freeform?
If we proceed, I'll start by asking about: document type, audience, desired impact, and any templates to follow.

best_practices: Provide complete context upfront - the more I know, the better guidance I can give
Answer clarifying questions specifically - brief justifications help me learn your priorities
Use the reader testing stage to catch assumptions that seem obvious to you but confuse others
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and expecting perfect first drafts
Providing minimal context then complaining output misses key points
Ignoring reader testing and publishing docs that confuse your actual audience

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works in Claude Code and Claude. Sub-agent testing is only available in Claude Code.

faq.question: What document types work best with this workflow?
faq.answer: Technical specs, PRDs, design docs, RFCs, decision records, proposals, and architectural documents.

faq.question: How long does the process typically take?
faq.answer: It varies by document complexity. A simple doc takes 30-60 minutes. Complex specs may require multiple sessions.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files or external services?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure prompt-based workflow. Any file access requires your explicit permission through the AI.

faq.question: Can I use my own document templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Share your template during Stage 1 and the workflow will adapt to follow your preferred structure.

faq.question: How is this different from regular AI chat?
faq.answer: The structured approach ensures completeness, tests readability, and prevents context gaps that plague typical AI-assisted writing.
